29.brief: Abimelek, the name of two Philistine kings and of two Israelites
near, with or among; often in general, to
Abraham, the later name of Abram

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
themselves (often used emphatic for the copula, also in indirect relation)
seven (as the sacred full one); also (adverbially) seven times; by implication, a week; by extension, an indefinite number
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to station, in various applications (literally or figuratively)
properly, separation; by implication, a part of the body, branch of atree, bar forcarrying; figuratively, chief of a city; especially (with prepositional prefix) as an adverb, apart, only, besides

30.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
seven (as the sacred full one); also (adverbially) seven times; by implication, a week; by extension, an indefinite number
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, crossed, i.e. (abstractly) transit; used only adverbially, on account of, in order that
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to pry into; by implication, to delve, to explore
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

31.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
to seven oneself, i.e. swear (as if by repeating a declaration seven times)

32.brief: to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
Abimelek, the name of two Philistine kings and of two Israelites
a head person (of any rank or class)
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
near, with or among; often in general, to
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a Pelishtite or inhabitant of Pelesheth

33.brief: properly, to strike in, i.e. fix; specifically, to plant (literally or figuratively)
a tamarisk tree; by extension, a grove of any kind
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

34.brief: properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather forhostility (as afraid)
Abraham, the later name of Abram
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a Pelishtite or inhabitant of Pelesheth
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
